articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/bbcnews
articles.title: Bobi Wine protests: Uganda army sorry over beating journalists
articles.description: Soldiers were caught on film hitting a photographer covering a protest over the arrest of an MP.

articles.author: Jonathan Drake
articles.title: Protesters topple Confederate soldier statue in North Carolina
articles.description: Protesters toppled a statue of a Confederate soldier on the campus of University of North Carolina on Monday, the latest move to dismantle Civil War symbols amid a fierce debate about race and the legacy of slavery in the United States.

articles.title: Two arrested for allegedly spying for Iran in U.S.
articles.description: Two Iranian men were indicted on Monday for allegedly spying for Tehran in the United States, including conducting surveillance at a Jewish facility and gathering information on backers of the militant Iranian opposition Mujahideen-e Khalq, the Justice Depart…

articles.author: Poppy McPherson
articles.title: U.N says it is still denied 'effective access' to Myanmar's Rakhine
articles.description: The United Nations is awaiting “effective access” to the Myanmar region where 700,000 Rohingya Muslims were driven out in an army crackdown, months after agreeing with the government to aid the return of refugees, the U.N. country head said on Tuesday.

articles.author: Robert Muller
articles.title: 'Punch to the face': Czechs mark half-century since Soviet invasion
articles.description: Fifty years ago Soviet tanks rolled into Prague to crush the Czechoslovak Communist government's democratic reforms, ushering in a bloody occupation whose lessons many Czechs fear have been forgotten.

articles.author: Alexandra Ma
articles.title: The US has deported a 95-year-old Nazi concentration camp guard who was living in Queens
articles.description: Jakiw Palij, a 95-year-old former Nazi concentration camp guard, was deported early Tuesday morning. He had been living on welfare in Queens, New York, until his deportation. He landed in Dusseldorf, Germany, on Tuesday. Palij worked at the Trawniki Labor Cam…

articles.author: AP, AP
articles.title: Italian soccer body promises to punish Lazio for sexist fans
articles.description: The Italian soccer federation's secretary general says Lazio will be punished for fans trying to ban women from a section of Stadio Olimpico

articles.author: USA TODAY, Erin Kelly, USA TODAY
articles.title: First black female White House reporter to be honored with bronze statue
articles.description: The first African-American woman to cover the White House will be honored with a statue next month at a Washington museum dedicated to a free press.

articles.description: Bryce Love skips the big money of the NFL for another season at his beloved Stanford

articles.title: Once-safe GOP seats threatened by blue wave
articles.description: Rep. Steve Chabot and others are facing tough races for the first time in years.

articles.author: Prak Chan Thul
articles.title: Two Cambodian journalists facing spying charges freed on bail
articles.description: Two Cambodian journalists charged with espionage for filing news reports to a U.S.-funded radio station were freed on bail on Tuesday, in a move seen by a rights group as a government bid to improve its image weeks after a disputed election.
